{"step_by_step_thinking": "The relevant documents suggest methods for intrauterine devices, contraceptives, dental transplants, retention sutures, and ovulation induction. Post-coital contraception typically refers to emergency or after-the-fact methods of preventing pregnancy. Intrauterine devices are a type of long-acting reversible contraception (LARC), which are not typically used for post-coital contraception. The other options - Desogestrel, Copper-T, and Levonorgestrel - are all forms of hormonal contraception that can be used as emergency contraception after unprotected sex.", "answer_choice": B}
